intro: Alsomitra timorana, commonly known as the Timor climbing fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red berries that contain the seeds. Alsomitra timorana thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
